definition: variant of 視|视[shi4]/variant of 示[shi4]

sentences.english: Are you aware that many researchers are convinced that prolonged close work causes myopia?
sentences.chinese: 你认为，许多研究员确信长期近距离工作引起近视吗？

sentences.english: But such myopia is also deeply regrettable.
sentences.chinese: 但这样的近视也令人深感遗憾。

sentences.english: How can you distinguish pseudomyopia and true sex myopia?
sentences.chinese: 怎样能分清假性近视和真性近视？

sentences.english: How can you distinguish pseudomyopia and true sex myopia?
sentences.chinese: 怎样能分清假性近视和真性近视？

sentences.english: This is a pair of spectacles for nearsighted persons.
If they are wearing the glasses normally prescribed for myopia, their vision will deteriorate.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们正常地配戴近视眼睛，他们的视力会恶化。

sentences.english: All of this is ignored when a child becomes myopic.
sentences.chinese: 当儿童成为近视时，完全没有这些知识。

sentences.english: Here is a closer view of bone metastases.
How should myopia hold an eye not bulgy come?
sentences.chinese: 近视要怎么样保持眼睛不凸出来？

sentences.english: Wearing lower degree convex lens can reduce incidence rate of myopia in primary school students.
sentences.chinese: 配戴低度凸透镜可降低小学生近视的发生率。

sentences.english: Servere myopia has obvious effect on the stability of tear film.
sentences.chinese: 近视对泪膜稳定性有一定影响。

sentences.english: The therapy based on the principle of convergence is an efficient curative on juvenile myopia.
sentences.chinese: 双眼合象法是一种较有效的青少年近视防治方法。

sentences.english: I had a test of my eyesight yesterday and I have got more near-sighted.
sentences.chinese: 我昨天测了视力，我近视得更厉害了。

sentences.english: Doesn`t reading in poor light make the eyes focus more and cause myopia to increase?
sentences.chinese: 在暗光下阅读，不会使双眼过度聚焦，引起近视加重？

sentences.english: As myopia increases, the eye grows longer than it was ever designed to do.
sentences.chinese: 由于近视眼增加，视力比以前设计的，长得更长。

sentences.english: Conclusions Progressive addition lenses can be used to slow down myopia development effectively in teenagers.
sentences.chinese: 结论渐进多焦镜能有效减缓青少年近视的发展。

definition: dry eye/xerophthalmia (drying of the tear glands, often due to lack of vitamin A)
eye floaters (moving spots in the eye's vitreous humor)
to diffuse light/see also 散光[san3 guang1]
